Description: Complete narrow-sleeved tunic in undyed, plain weave linen; full length tapestry clavi and double cuff-bands in purple and red wool and undyed linen; design on clavi and bands of contiguous small roundels containg the following motifs - vine leaves and tendrills, small bird, pomegranate and leaves, bust of a human wearing a tunic, foreparts of an ibex, bear, bull?, dog and hare; straight outer border, trefoils in spandrels between roundels and border; simple selvedges at hem, neck-opening and underneath sleeves; short warp fringe at sides and end of each sleeve (on sleeves is held by a single row of hitches) preceded by a narrow band of bare warp threads; no seams remaining but traces of sewing at sides where warp fringe has been turned back, at seam joining front and back, at sleeves where there was a tapering seam and across waist where there was a tuck, c.9cm deep, giving four lines of stitching; just in from seams at side are three pairs of self-bands which continue over shoulder where there are also additional pairs; also three pairs of self-bands along just inside clavi and a single pair outside clavi; apparently no other reinforcement at neck but at 8.5cm in from clavi are a pair of brocaded red wool threads (a single thread returning just above where the tuck began); very worn and torn in area of neck, shoulders and underarms; in places is roughly repaired; many areas impregnated with oil substance with an aromatic smell; weft-faced palin weave: warp-undyed linen (S/c.23), weft-undyed linen (S/c.13); tapestry on grouped threads: warp undyed linen (S), weft-coloured wool and undyed linen (S/c.60); sewing traces in linen thread (S paired and S spun Z ply) and yellow thread (S paired)
Acquisition name: Purchased through: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
